Name: BattleTech: Racice River Delta/Deployment Zone Battlemat
Description:
Battles of Tukayyid Battlemat

This map is 34” x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.

This map details the Racice River Delta (Clan Smoke Jaguar) on one side and Deployment Zone on the other side.

Name: BattleTech: Holth Forest/Lake Losiije Battlemat
Description:
Battles of Tukayyid Battlemat

This map is 34” x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.

This map details the Holth Forest (Clan Ghost Bear) on one side and Lake Losije (Clan Nova Cat) on the other side.

Name: BattleTech: Robyn's Crossing/Devil's Bath Battlemat
Description:
Battles of Tukayyid Battlemat

This map is 34” x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.

This map details the Robyn's Crossing (Clan Jade Falcon) on one side and Devil's Bath (Clan Steel Viper) on the other side.

Name: BattleTech: Pozoristu Mountains/Kozice Valley Battlemat
Description:
Battles of Tukayyid Battlemat

This map is 34” x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.

This map details the Pozoristu Mountains (Clan Wolf) on one side and Kozice Valley (Clan Diamond Shark) on the other side.

Name: BattleTech: Chaos Campaign – Succession Wars
Description:
Chaos Campaign: Succession Wars provides rules for selecting a force and embarking on a planetary assault mini-campaign, as well as tools to create campaigns of your own.

This module introduces Chaos Campaign play, which offers consequences between individual missions, a reason to chase down specific objectives while preserving your troops, and ways to improve your force as you progress.!

Name: Personal Space: The Retreat Moon
Description:
The Retreat Moon is an expansion for Personal Space and requires the base game to play.

The Retreat Moon is a new moon that you can visit during your games of Personal Space.

Orbit: 11:00-12:00 AM/PM
Popular Attraction: Reflection Rocks
Local Cuisine: Magical Acorns

New Neighbor: You will gain one of four new neighbors:

    Badger Hawthorn
    Falcon Starling
    Hazel Emberly
    Savannah Cornelia

Name: BattleTech: House Arano – The Aurigan Coalition
Description:
High Lady Kamea Arano led a rebellion, dispatched the usurpers who stole her throne, dismantled their dictatorial government, and restored peace to the Aurigan Coalition. Now her true battle begins…

The Arano Restoration has succeeded, and High Lady Kamea rules over the reunited Aurigan Coalition. But all is not well – the Coalition’s hardscrabble planets teeter on the brink of collapse, while its powerful neighbors await another chance to subvert House Arano. More than ever, the Coalition needs warriors willing to do whatever it takes to claim victory.

House Arano: The Aurigan Coalition brings the setting of the hit PC strategy game BattleTech into the long-running tabletop experience. Learn the proud history of the Coalition and its hope for the future, then take up the defense of the Arano dynasty with four all-new scenarios picking up where the game left off.

To survive on the fringes of the Inner Sphere, those of noble birth must once again call on champions of mercenary mind.

Name: Trolling for Trouble: Chain Devil
Description:
An additional player character for Trolling for Trouble, the Chain Devil. Attributes are listed on card.


Released in the December 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: The Hunt for Bread in October
Description:
Crisis in the Kremlin!

You are a Russian, a citizen of the new Republic. Gone forever are the days of Soviet Buracracy [sic] and waiting in Bread Lines.

Now with a Free Market Economy you wish you had those bread lines. Food is now a luxury item and a simple loaf of bread is hard to find and keep!

You are now on a Hunt for Bread in October!

Hunt for Bread in October is a fun and fast Micro Game for two or more players.

Bread Not Included!

—description from the publisher

A tongue-in-cheek tactical combat game where players fight over a loaf of bread. Each player controls a character represented by three randomly determined stats: Strength, Dexterity, and Stamina. The game is played on a square grid representing a bread shop. The basic object of the game is for the characters to beat the heck out of each other in an effort to obtain the bread and exit the bread shop.

To start the game, one player is selected at random to be in possession of the bread. The other players then set up their characters around the one with the bread. Starting with the player who has the bread, each player takes a turn consisting of movement and combat actions.

These turns continue until one player's character escapes with the bread, somebody flips over the game board, or everybody just gets tired of the silliness and moves on to a real game. Somewhat similar in spirit to the parody game Panzer Pranks, the emphasis of Bread in October appears to be on satire rather than simulation or playability.

—user summary

Name: Chuck & Cover
Description:
From time to time differences must be settled by a duel. Hands will clash causing expected and unexpected events but if you use your wits, you can come out on top. Remember, strength in numbers can lead to victory.

Each player takes a card at random and places it on the table on the side of their choice. Each turn, at the count of 3, both players are going to chuck simultaneously revealing a number of fingers (1-4) on one hand. Once revealed, both numbers will be added together to form the Target Number. Each player will cover that number on their card, and use its special ability.

The game ends when a player is unable to cover the Target Number on their card. The other player is declared the winner.

Name: Socks Monster
Description:
Compete to have the best stall with the best combination of monsters.

Socks Monster is a competitive game, in which we will have to take into account both sides of the cards: On one side we find the monsters and on the other the socks. The goal of the game is to finish with the most points at the end of the game, thanks to the connections of the socks and the bonuses of the monsters.

At the beginning of the game two cards are dealt to each player and with the remaining cards four equal draw decks are made showing the sides of the socks.

In turns, the player draws a card from any draw deck and then plays a card on the table. We must always start on our first turn with a monster and then follow the placement rules.

We will be playing cards forming our stall and making chains of socks to be able to lower other monsters. The socks are connected and superimposed following the placement rules and the requests of the monsters.

At the end of the game we will get points for the correct connections of the socks, the score bonuses of the monsters and we will subtract points for the stinky socks.

In addition, the game has a small variant, where the weather symbols come into play and add more interaction and bite to the game.

Name: The Viral Vegetable Wars
Description:
Hell in the Kitchen

Contaminated:  It's a quiet night in a suburban home when something animates the vegetables and sends them on a war of extermination!

Viral Vegetable Wars is a fast Micro Game of combat on the move as Humans and Vegetables try to eliminate each other.

You can take back your home if you have the guts and the gun.


     A Complete Micro Game
     Fast & Inexpensive
     Hours of Fun
     Expandable
     Bio-Degradable
     Politically Incorrect
     Dice Not Included


—description from the publisher

A wacky tactical wargame of humans fighting off animated vegetables seeking to escape from a household where the vegetables mysteriously sprang to life.

Designed to be played on a hex grid using counters, but the game can also be played directly on the tabletop. Each Human and Vegetable unit is rated for movement, attack, and defense. There are also weapons and other resource items that can be used to assist the Human player. Tri Tac's Bureau 13 can make a cameo appearance courtesy of an optional rule introducing those forces into the game.

The game portrays a battle to the death, where each side tries to eliminate the other. However, the humans can score a partial victory by getting the family into a car and escaping.

—user summary
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Land of Gods
Description:
The conflict between the gods has caused the creatures to be lost in another dimension, so the players have to attract them and form the most powerful pyramid. We will have to acquire the different types of creatures, magic, water, fire and plant that will help us achieve victory.

In Land of Gods, players will have the objective of forming the most powerful pyramid, as God you will have to attract creatures to your lands and combat them in the best possible way.

We will draw four environment cards that will become part of the objectives of the game and we will deal three cards to each player that will be taken to their hand and with the rest of the cards we make two equal decks with the creatures face up.

The turn of both players will be played at the same time, having to put into play a creature face down that will become part of the individual pyramid of each one.

The creature played will then be revealed and the type of the creature will be compared: The highest type on the reference card will win the trick. In the example, the water type card wins, since it is above the fire type on the scale.

The winner of the trick will be the first to choose a visible creature from the two draw decks, the other player must take the other deck.

In turn, each type of creature has an ability when played that can trigger different direct and optional effects.

Every time a turn ends we will check if someone completes an environment and at that moment they can claim it.

This is how the turns will go by, in which we will have to take into account the rules for placing the pyramid and also what the creatures themselves demand of us in order to activate their power-ups. In the conditions and enhancers, having a number of different creatures, adjacency of some specific type, that there are no fire creatures in our pyramid... the God that best combines his creatures and scores the most points, will be the winner.

Name: Les défis du Père Noël
Description:
In the North Pole, it’s the same story every year: Santa is trying to choose the best team of helpers on whom he will be able to count on to ensure the delivery of the presents during Christmas Night.

To select the best team, he relies on his companions to guide and lead some bold and daring elves through Santa’s 6 challenges. Each companion becomes head instructor for the elves. The aspiring elves’ ability in math, keen sense of observation, phonological awareness and general motor skills will be tried and tested. They will also be given the opportunity to demonstrate solidarity and kindness, two significant values in the North Pole...

—description from the publisher (translated)

Comme tous les ans, au pôle Nord, c’est la même histoire : père Noël cherche l’équipe de lutins sur laquelle il pourra compter pour l’aider à effectuer la livraison des cadeaux pendant la nuit de Noël.

Pour faire son choix, il compte sur ses acolytes pour guider et entraîner des lutins courageux à travers les 6 défis du père Noël. Chaque acolyte devient un maître entraîneur de lutin. Les aptitudes mathématiques, le sens de l’observation, la conscience phonologique et la motricité globale des aspirants lutins seront mis à l'entraînement. Ils auront aussi la chance de faire preuve d’entraide et de bienveillance, 2 valeurs très importantes au pôle Nord...

—description from the publisher

Name: Crimes & Capers: And the Winner Is... Dead
Description:
You are a nominee at the 67th Annual Music Awards! Unfortunately, you won't be winning anything tonight. Our host Mannie, America's Sweetheart Pop Star, is dead. We are asking that you remain in the green room for your safety. While there, try to open Mannie's purse to look for clues as to what went down at rehearsal that led to her murder.

Crimes & Capers: And the Winner Is... Dead is a co-operative game in which you and a group of friends take on the roles of famous recording artists and work together to solve the mystery. No special skills or prior knowledge are required. Read social media posts and solve puzzles to unlock Mannie's purse, then figure out who murdered her!

—description from the publisher

Name: Witches of Wickville
Description:
The Witches of Wickville are cursed! Every century, covens fight to be the first to complete the sacred ritual of the Grimoire. If you defeat the other witches OR summon your Guardian, you will break the curse, but if you fail, your coven will be banished to the shadows until the next ritual.

In Witches of Wickville, a game of witches in which from 1 to 4 players we can face each other to win the victory. The objective of the game is to be the first to light our candles to activate the ritual and wake up our guardian or we can also win by defeating the enemy by throwing the three cursed potions at him.

At the beginning of the game, the players choose a witch from each team who will represent their character during the game.

Then we place both guardians in the center of the table on their inactive side, shuffle the rest of the witchcraft cards and place them randomly on their inactive side, forming a circle around the guardians.

The game will take place in turns, in which we will have a compulsory action and two optional ones.

We must always move and optionally we can flip a card and/or use our character's ability.

Every time we flip a card, the cards activate an ability that must be executed, that card can produce chain effects, flip the next card, deactivate a specific card... and so on.

The first player to have all four candles lit and the grimoire book on the side of his color will activate his guardian, lighting his four candles a second time will make him the winner of the ritual.

But beware! With the yellow potions, if you throw all three potions you will damage the opposing witch, if you do it a second time, it will be another way to defeat him and win.

Name: Mageling: Rise of the Ancient Ones
Description:
Enemies of the Evertree have rallied behind the Cult of Asdea: An insidious force, that will stop at nothing to break open the void, and unleash Asdea, devourer of life, upon the world. Should Asdea awaken, her festering hunger will spare no being. The Evertree is not yet strong enough to defend its people, and so once again all hope turns to the Magelings! With the teachings of moth-mage Theone to guide them, they must enter the dark wilds of Shada Swamp. There, through the mist of the Green Veil, the damp of the Fungal Bog, and the dangers of the Tellurian Ruins, they will root out the forces of Asdea. Perhaps they will even face the Ancient One herself...

Mageling: Rise of the Ancient Ones is no game of chance. It will take wise use of your scrolls, your potions, your mana, and your mageling’s powers to snatch victory from between Asdea’s jaws. Do not despair— though the road may be hard, this is still a world worth saving! Rise to the challenge, magelings!

Mageling, bring your hope, your determination, and your skill; but beware. The Ancient Ones rise.

—description from the designer

Name: Candies for Cthulhu
Description: Candies for Cthulhu is a printable Roll & Write in which the Cthulhu gang has become addicted to sugar and will attack on Halloween all the houses that do not have supplies of sweets, that is why we must deliver the different packages of sweets and protect all the houses in our neighborhood.

Name: The Clinic: Are You Mad?
Description:
The Clinic is a psychological quiz game based on celebrity and popular culture, ideally for use as a party game.

The Clinic's gameplay is similar to psychological profile quizzes found in magazines, where players answer a series of multiple choice questions and eventually arrive at a set psychological profile at the end.

The game's name and theme comes from the UK media obsession with fame, celebrity, and the pressures of being in the spotlight, as illustrated by publications such as Heat (magazine), OK!, Hello! and similar. It seeks to play on the notion that any normal person can be thrust into the limelight via reality and talent shows such as Big Brother or The X Factor.

Name: War on High
Description:
It's the last place you'd think would erupt into violence as the forces of Evil begin their last attempt to take Heaven.

War on High is a fast Micro Game of combat on the move as two or more players fight the final war of Armageddon and try to eliminate each other.

You can Storm or Protect Heaven if you have the skill and the Courage!


     A Complete Micro Game
     Fast & Inexpensive
     Hours of Fun
     Expandable
     Bio-Degradable
     Politically Incorrect
     Dice Not Included


No. Don't look for intellectual content or deep meanings in these cheap games.

—description from the publisher

An offbeat (to say the least) tactical wargame of conflict between the forces of Heaven and Hell. Hellspawn are fighting to occupy the heavenly throne while the forces of Heaven will prevail if they can seal off the pit leading to Hell - this is done with a "plug" that is represented by one of the game's counters.

While War on Heaven was designed to be played on a hex grid using counters, the game can also be played directly on the tabletop. Each Heaven and Hell unit is rated for movement, attack, and defense.

Optional rules allow the forces of Tri Tac's Bureau 13, who are heavily armed with firearms and an anti-tank rocket, to make a cameo appearance in the battle.

—user summary

Name: Gataria
Description:
Nyx is a cat who lives with Petunia, the cutest apprentice witch you have ever seen, and they take care of each other, along with doing a lot of trickery. Nyx is getting old, though, and preparing to retire, so Petunia will be need of a new companion soon! That's why they're looking to adopt a new kitten to learn all about being a witches' cat!

Each player controls a magic copy of a cat, who will try to showcase their skills to either reach the tower at the center of the board or capture 3 cats from other players.

Every turn they will place their movement tile on the table and, in ascending order, jump to an adjacent roof with the same color or number. They can also use magic portals to navigate from one edge to another. If at any point they meet another cat, this one will be captured unless they yield a treat to distract!

Petunia also offers treats that can be traded for attack, defense and trick cards, or by keys to the tower. At the end of every round, one of the players moves Nyx, shattering a roof and creating new portals and connections!

Name: Blood Rage: Mountain Giant
Description: This miniature was an exclusive Stretch Goal from the Blood Rage Kickstarter. This fearsome monster comes with its figure and card to add to your Age 1 deck. The Mountain Giant is a true behemoth, but since it counts as a leader, it can invade for free, and even benefit from Leader Upgrades you add to your clan!

Name: Warsemble
Description:
Warsemble is a turn-based strategy game for two to four players. The rules of the game allow for different situational games in which the target, the size of the field, and the size of the armies can vary.

There are only three rules in Warsemble (movement, rest, and battle), which reflect principles of actual military action:

The game is played in turns. With each turn, the player can move or update all figures.


     Movement: Figures can move in four directions (forward, backward, left, and right) to adjacent accessible squares. Each time a figure enters a new square, its strength is reduced by points equal to the effort value of the square. Within each turn, the figure can be moved to as many positions as its strength allows.



     Rest: Each figure that stays in place and is not attacked increases its strength by one point each turn, until it reaches a maximum strength of six.



     Attack: The attacking figure must enter the square of the opponent figure, following the rules of movement (i.e., it must expend the strength needed to enter the opponent's square). After moving, the strengths of the two figures are compared and the stronger of the two survives.


The game is won by the player who first brings the crown to the base.

—description from the designer

Name: Mec Squash
Description:
The creatures of Blorb 212 were more than a match for the first explorers that tried to take their world. When a series of attempts to colonize the planet failed, the company that had claimed Blorb 212 waited. After a few years of planning, they began dropping machines down to the planet’s surface to rid it of the mutant monsters that lived there.

The company never figured on the damage to their robots from the blue-white sun. The robots soon began battling each other as well as the monsters.

Realizing they could never colonize the world, the company began sponsoring contests for engineers to build specialized combat robots.

With orbital and ground monitors it became the new spectator sport of the 23rd century.

—description from the publisher

Sculpt your own combat robots from clay then assign the game characteristics for armor, movement, weaponry, flight capability, and head and body styles. Then fight out a battle on the tabletop using the Squash miniatures rules system. Optional rules include initiative, advanced weapons, terrain, and power cells.

—user summary

Name: Mutant Squash
Description:
The creatures of Blorb 212 were more than a match for the first explorers that tried to take over their world. When a series of attempts to colonize the planet failed, the company that that claimed Blorb 212 waited. After a few years of planning, they began dropping MECs and BUGs to the Planet’s surface to rid it of the monsters that lived there.

The company never figured on the mutating effects from the chemicals combining with the the energy of the blue-white sun. The monsters soon began battling each other as they mutated into new and strange forms.

Realizing they could never colonize the world, the company took a last gamble and dropped 1000 reluctant human colonists to destroy the creatures. Like everything else, they also mutated.

The battle was on!

—description from the publisher

Sculpt your own otherworldly mutants from clay. Next, assign them game characteristics for armor, movement, weaponry, and flight capability. Then fight out battles on the tabletop using the Squash miniatures rules system. Optional rules include initiative, advanced weapons, terrain, and food cells.

—user summary

Name: Giant Japanese Monster Squash
Description:
The creatures of Blorb 212 were more than a match for the first explorers that tried to take over their world. When a series of attempts to colonize the planet failed, the company that had claimed Blorb 212 waited. After a lot of years of planning, they began dropping the ultimate biological weapon down to the Planet’s surface to rid it of the mutant monsters that lived there.

The company never figured on the mutating effects from the 'Zilla Class' bio-chemicals combined with the blue-white sun. The monsters soon began battling each other as they mutated into new and stranger life forms.

Realizing they could never colonize the world, the company began watching the monsters and realized it was a source of cheap entertainment until they could come up with a better idea. With orbital and ground monitors, it became the new spectator sport of the 23rd century.

—description from the publisher

Sculpt your own kaijÅ« style monsters from clay. Next, assign them game characteristics for armor, movement, weaponry, and flight capability. Then fight out battles on the tabletop using the Squash miniatures rules system. Optional rules include advanced weapons (such as atomic breath), initiative, terrain, and energy cells.

—user summary

Name: People Squash
Description:
The creatures of Blorb 212 were more than a match for the first explorers that tried to take over their world. When a series of attempts to colonize the planet failed, the company that had claimed Blorb 212 waited.

After a few years of planning, they began dropping Mecs and a host of other creatures and life forms to the Planet’s surface to rid it of the mutant monsters that lived there.

But this failed also and the company that would call the planet their own, decided on a final course of action. The next step was to create a vast army of high level executives and decision makers that had decided to colonize this awful place.

Like everything else tried on this arm pit of the Galaxy, the plan backfired.

The people dropped on Blorb began to attack everything, including themselves, as they mutated into new and even more bizarre forms.

EPILOGUE

From sea to scummy sea, Blorb 212 became a littered junk yard of dead MONSTERS, MECS, BUGS, MUTANTS, and PEOPLE. The monsters still hunted the world but many had talked to the human invaders. It was hard, but they realized what was at the root of their problem. Now, with their friends, the Humans, they would someday get even with the corporation who created this mess.

As the battles continued, they plotted...

—description from the publisher

The final entry in Tri-Tac's sometimes bizarre "Squash" series of self-sculpted tabletop-miniatures battle games.

In this installment, you sculpt your own human figurines from clay. Next, assign the figures game characteristics for "armor," movement, and weaponry. Then fight out battles on the tabletop using the Squash miniatures rules system. Optional rules include advanced weapons, initiative, and terrain.

—user summary

Name: Bug Squash
Description:
The creatures of Blorb 212 were more than a match for the first explorers that tried to take over their world. When a series of attempts to colonize the planet failed, the company that had claimed Blorb 212 waited. After a few years of planning, they began dropping Mecs down to the Planet’s surface to rid it of the mutant monsters that lived there.

But this failed also and the company that would call the planet their own, decided on a new course of action. The next step was to create a vast army of mutant insects to destroy the Monsters and Robots.

Like everything else tried on this hostile world, the plan backfired. The BUGS began to attack everything, including themselves, as they mutated into new and bizarre forms.

The battle was on!

—description from the publisher

Sculpt your own alien BUGS from clay based on a number of traditional insect body types. Next assign your BUGS game characteristics for armor, movement, natural weaponry, and flight capability. Then fight out battles on the tabletop using the Squash miniatures rules system. Optional rules include initiative, advanced weapons, terrain, and food cells.

—user summary

Name: Dauercamper, Dosenbier und eine Leiche
Description:
All hell breaks loose on the campsite at Teufelssee! The owner Gisela Nickel was murdered - at the end of the autumn festival of the permanent campers, of all things.

Story

The smell of steaks and bratwurst was in the air. Now that the vacation season was coming to an end and the last tourists had left, the campsite at Teufelssee was once again firmly in the hands of the few loyal permanent campers. At the joint autumn festival, numerous homemade salads were dished up to say goodbye to the summer with beer and sausage. Together they ate and drank extensively and reminisced.

The party should have been the prelude to the quiet and relaxing half of the camper year. But what was meant to be a celebration took a dramatic turn during the evening when the campground's grumpy, chain-smoking owner, Gisela Nickel, was found dead in the reception area. How could this celebration have ended so fatally?

Players

4 female and 4 male roles (with 8 people). Male roles can be played by women and vice versa.

—description from the publisher (translated)
Families: Series: Murder Mystery Games (Culinario Mortale Inc.)

Name: BattleTech: Dig, Defend or Die
Description:
Stotzing was not an easy planet to settle. The first colony, Eisenstadt, failed after less than a decade and its location was lost to historians for almost five centuries. The final throes of The Jihad caused the announcement of the discovery to be relegated to the small number of archaeologists and historians interested in lost colonies. But there was one other group that caught wind of this discovery—the Green Ghosts

Dig Defend or Die was the 2018 BattleTech World Wide Event depicting the clash between the Green Ghosts and the First Marik Defenders. Includes the Total Warfare and Alpha Strike scenario as well as the final results of the event.

Name: BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Mercenaries Cards
Description: Alpha Strike Mercenaries Cards includes 36 double-sided (72 units) cards with all the game stats player need to instantly take to the battlefield. The cards reflect the Units listed in a wide variety of eras. Full-color and laminated for dry-erase use, you just need miniatures and you'll be playing BattleTech like never before!

Name: BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Kurita Cards
Description: Alpha Strike Kurita Cards includes 36 double-sided cards (72 units) with all the game stats player need to instantly take to the battlefield. The cards reflect the Units listed in a wide variety of eras. Full-color and laminated for dry-erase use, you just need miniatures and you'll be playing BattleTech like never before!

Name: Wolfenstein: The Old Blood
Description:
This isn't the first time that BJ has visited Castle Wolfenstein.  In 1946, he and Agent One, Richard Wesley, successfully infiltrated the fortress.  The objective was simple; grab some intel and get out.  What they discovered within the walls of the Castle were unspeakable horrors.
Start your campaign in Castle Wolfenstein and find a way to escape while Rudi Jäger is on your back!  Navigate through the streets of Wulfburg and discover what the Nazis are secretly working on!

Wolfenstein: The Old Blood offers players four new scenarios that make up a closed prequel campaign with five new hero cards (and minis) and the ability to control your own Mech.  It includes two new bosses (The Monstrosity and Rudi Jäger) and three new enemy types that come in two different variants each.

Name: Lindisfarne Monastery
Description:
Lindisfarne Monastery is a competitive euro-style dice worker placement game about monks working at a Christian monastery in the early Medieval period. Inspired by the real monastery of Lindisfarne, players work to create resources, feed themselves, and write religious texts for the library, culminating in the great Lindisfarne Gospels.

The monks are represented by dice, and the pips on the dice represent their level of experience. As the monks are placed on action spaces each round, their pips are converted to action points to spend in that action space. Each round, the player who has pip majority in each action space may claim an available bonus, which may include the ability to pip up a die.

Monks can also be sent in pilgrimage to holy sites overseas, and to collect rare, vivid inks to take home for use in their scriptorium. The monks must also beware the Vikings, who raid the monastery every summer, and who must be paid off in beer and mead, lest they steal the treasures of the monastery or murder the monks!

A full game of Lindisfarne Monastery is played over four game rounds, representing calendar years, where in each year there are two action phases, and within each action phase the monk dice are placed, and then resolved. Points are scored from pilgrimage, from writing religious texts, commissioning treasures for the monastery chapel, and for retiring monk dice from the board. The player with the highest total score at the end of the game is declared the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Uncle Al's Upgrade Pack
Description: This expansion for Car Wars (Sixth Edition) adds 186 cards; 45 per player color, plus 6 checkpoint cards.

Name: Cards Against Humanity: Climate Catastrophe Pack
Description:
It’s 2021, and humanity is broken. The world cannot get its shit together to do anything about climate change. That’s why Cards Against Humanity is convening a historic summit of world leaders releasing a pack of funny cards.

The Climate Catastrophe Pack comes with 30 new cards about how fucked we are. 100% of the profits will go to the Coalition for Rainforest Nations to stop deforestation — one of the most cost-effective ways to fight climate change. The pack also includes thousands of tree seeds you can plant to assuage your feelings of powerlessness while civilization collapses around you.

Name: Floriferous: Early Spring Mini Expansion
Description:
The Early Spring Mini Expansion  introduces 3 new action cards in each player color. These single-use cards introduce ways to switch cards around in the garden and look at face-down cards. Enjoy the new strategies in your floriferous garden!

—description from the publisher

Name: Klick-Klock
Description:
A new pencil-and-paper game for one or two players.

Taking turns, players draw straight lines on a grid of n × n dots, with n ≥ 3. Each line must connect at least 3 dots, all adjacent. From the second move, each line that is drawn must contain exactly one dot from the previous line. Lines may not be partially or totally overlapping. On each turn, and after having drawn a line, the player has the option of removing a free dot from the grid—that is, a dot that is not part of any line. 
The player who makes the last move wins.

Published in Decemeber 2021 issue of Games World of Puzzles Magazine

Name: WarBonds: Battle For Vitoria
Description:
"WarBonds: Battle For Vitoria" is a strategy war game where players deploy and mobilize a medieval fantasy army in an effort to reign supreme amidst the war torn lands of Vitoria. Players start with a unique warlord that’ll serve as the leader of their army, and the first unit deployed onto the Battle Map. Each warlord is vying for control and ideological dominance. All units, warlords included, have an ideological alignment that will be tried by the brutalities of war. Players will make nuanced decisions that will affect the leadership of their warlord, and the loyalty of their units.

One such decision involves influencing the public to incite revolt or enforce order across the land. Inciting a revolt is looked upon favorably by all chaos alignment units, but unfavorable to all law alignment units. Such a decision will cause these units to gain or lose loyalty. Units without loyalty are susceptible to leaving your army; or worse, be persuaded by the leadership of an opponent's warlord to join their army. There is no randomness; players must out-think their opponents to achieve victory.

To achieve victory, a player must satisfy any one of the below conditions:

     Be the last player with a surviving warlord and war camp.
         If your warlord is killed, you lose the game.
         If your war camp is destroyed, you lose the game.
    
     Be the first player to gain a level 3 war camp.
     If the dragon arrives, when it reaches the End of Game event, have the largest army size (IE: victory points).


When a game is fully set up and ready to start, the gameplay runs through a cycle of game rounds until one player achieves victory. A game round consists of a series of ordered turn handling for the deployed and enabled units and war camps; followed by the handling of various ordered events. The next game round starts after all aforementioned game objects have completed their respective turns, and each event has been handled. To assist with tracking and management of a game round an Initiative Table is used to indicate which in-game object’s turn must be handled next. Players only take their turn when one of their owned and controlled in-game object is designated to take their respective turn. This cycle of starting and ending game rounds proceeds until a player achieves a victory condition, or the game reaches its final round triggering the End of Game event.

In WarBonds: Battle For Vitoria each player selects a single warlord from a pool of warlords for which to start their war campaign with. Afterwards, in the same order, all players select their starting war camp and warlord location on the battle map. Once war camp and warlord placement is complete, the game can now begin, starting with the player whose warlord has the lowest initiative score indicated on the Initiative Table. As each round progresses, players will select and deploy various units to make up their army.

—description from the designer

Name: Age of Steam: Osaka
Description:
This expansion puts players as the presidents of comedian training schools in Osaka.  Each color of cubes represents a different type of comedy, and the black cubes represent the staff.

If cubes are delivered and there is not staff present to support the show, less income is received. Additionally, extra money can be received if the performer can enjoy the camaraderie of other performers in their niche along the way.

The map includes 2 new actions and special rules for 2-players.

Name: La Maldición: Héroes de Lorthar – Despertar de las Razas: Mazo de Expansión
Description:
Despertar de las Razas is the first expansion of the game La MaldiciÃ³n: HÃ©roes de Lorthar.

This is an expansion of 50 new cards for the base game, including new and effective cards, as well as 4 new heroes, increasing the round limit to a total of 12 players.

Addition of new game modes:


     Purgatory: A time trial mode where discard speed will be the only way to survive (ideal for multi-player games).



     Camaradas: A 2v2 duel, where the duo that best manages to combine their cards and trust each other will win.

Name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Playmat Bundle
Description:
Bring Car Wars Sixth Edition to life with these two 36" x 36" custom playmats that can be used separately or combined into one massive combat arena!

This bundle includes:

     Playmat #1 - The asphalt combat arena, which comes with 30 game cards and a rule sheet
     Playmat #3 - The off-road arena

Name: District 9: The Boardgame – Faction Expansion
Description:
The 5&6 player faction expansion for District 9: The Boardgame requires the core game in order to be used. These factions may be used in two different ways.

ALTERNATE FACTION: In a 2-4 player game, the Prawn Engineer or MNU Science Division may be selected by a player and set up as normal as defined by the setup section of the core rulebook.

ADDITIONAL PLAYERS: If desired, the new factions allow for 5 & 6 player games of the District 9 boardgame. To use the expansions in this manner, simply follow the setup section of the core rulebook, and add steps for the 5th and/or 6th player.

—description from the publisher

Name: 5-Kampf
Description:
The game consists of 5 exercises where players can score points. Whoever has collected the most points after the 5 exercises wins the game.
Exercise 1: Reaction test
Exercise 2: Memory test
Exercise 3: Skill test
Exercise 4: Combination test
Exercise 5: Faultfinding test

—user summary

Name: The Spin Doctors
Description:
The Spin Doctors is a game in which the players take on the role of the chief of staff and help their candidates in entering upon the highest office in the country.

The player, having a predetermined budget at their disposal, chooses appropriate campaign workers and uses their cards in each round to send them to different regions of the country with different tasks. Those could be an election rally, fundraising or an election trail. But they could also be a little less friendly forms of rivalry like incitement against political opponents, manipulation or propaganda. The player has to remember however, to plan these actions out carefully because all the campaign workers have their own distinct abilities, useful in specific situations, and only a limited number of them can carry out their tasks in each round. Moreover, the players have to predict the moves and the plans of their opponents, as the cards are placed on the board face down. They know where their opponents are sending their people, but they do not know which ones and with what tasks. They can also use their campaign workers to cooperate with the media, which can influence the turnout in several regions of the country as well as the topics important for the local communities. 
Additionally, the players must prepare an election program for their candidates and make sure that they fulfil as many promises as possible. Each mistake means a loss of votes and the risk of defeat.

Campaign workers’ actions influence the endorsement in each region and allow the candidates to earn endorsement points there. The one with the most endorsement points becomes the winner in the given region and gains votes from the local electorate which can represent one of 4 social groups.

The player with the most votes in all social groups at the end of the game wins the elections and becomes president. 
But remember that politics is often a brutal fight which doesn’t always encourage fair play, and media manipulation, provocation or leakage of compromising material are only a few of the challenges you will have to face. Everybody wants to win, and they will do anything to reach their goal.

Do you have the guts to grab for power?

—description from the publisher

Name: Da lacht das Sparschwein
Description:
The players move their game pieces over a circuit by rolling the dice and can win money from the bank on the individual fields, lose money to the piggy bank or receive the collected contents of the piggy bank. The first player to collect 10 marks wins the game.

—user summary

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Primitives vol 4
Description: Experimental Tech Readout: Primitives, Volume IV samples more of the early technology designs that dominated the universe of BattleTech during the pre-Star League Age of War period. Each design featured in this book demonstrates the primitive technology level of the first generation of BattleMechs, the last generation of Combat Vehicles (before the 'Mech supplanted them), and the low-tech aerospace units that flew above them. Although many were ultimately upgraded to ˆ_Ñ??modern standardsˆ? and shown in Technical Readout: 3075, the units featured here reflect these designs as they were when first introduced to the universe they fought for. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 Primitive BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

Name: Meme vs 100cia: CEO Ludoty promo card
Description:
A promotional Scientist card delivered in the November 2021 Ludoty Box.

Alba (CEO Ludoty)

     This is fine: You can't lose if you're waiting for your Ludoty.
     Dream Team: Take 1 Troll for each Ludoty you have received.

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Primitives vol 3
Description: Experimental Tech Readout: Primitives, Volume 3 samples more of the early technology designs that dominated the universe of BattleTech during the pre-Star League Age of War period. Each design featured in this book demonstrates the primitive technology level of the first generation of BattleMechs, the last generation of Combat Vehicles (before the 'Mech supplanted them), and the low-tech aerospace units that flew above them. Although many were ultimately upgraded to ˆ_Ñ??modern standardsˆ? and shown in Technical Readout: 3075, the units featured here reflect these designs as they were when first introduced to the universe they fought for. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 14 Primitive BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Primitives vol 2
Description:
Experimental Tech Readout: Primitives, Volume 2 samples more of the early technology designs that dominated the universe of BattleTech during the pre-Star League Age of War period. Each design featured in this book demonstrates the primitive technology level of the first generation of BattleMechs, the last generation of Combat Vehicles (before the 'Mech supplanted them), and the low-tech aerospace units that flew above them. Although many were ultimately upgraded to ˆ_Ñ??modern standardsˆ? and shown in Technical Readout: 3075, the units featured here reflect these designs as they were when first introduced to the universe they fought for.

Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 Primitive BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Primitives vol 1
Description: Experimental Tech Readout: Primitives, Volume 1 samples the early technology designs that dominated the universe of BattleTech during the pre-Star League Age of War period. Each design featured in this book demonstrates the primitive technology level of the first generation of BattleMechs, the last generation of Combat Vehicles (before the 'Mech supplanted them), and the low-tech aerospace units that flew above them. Although many were ultimately upgraded to ˆ_Ñ??modern standardsˆ? and shown in Technical Readout: 3075, the units featured here reflect these designs as they were when first introduced to the universe they fought for. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 Primitive BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Republic vol 3
Description:
Experimental Technical Readout: Republic (Volume 3) samples production and custom machines that have appeared in the BattleTech universe by the early decades of the thirty-second century. Each unit featured in this book incorporates some of the new technologies that debuted in both Tactical Operations and Interstellar Operations--now employed by the armed forces of the Republic of the Sphere and its contemporaries.

Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new advanced and experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, and aerospace and battle armor units ready for play in BattleTech games up to the year 3146.

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Republic vol 2
Description:
Experimental Technical Readout: Republic II samples production and custom machines that have appeared in the BattleTech universe by the early decades of the thirty-second century. Each unit featured in this book incorporates some of the new technologies that debuted in Tactical Operations--now employed by the armed forces of the Republic of the Sphere and its contemporaries.

Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new advanced and experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, and aerospace and battle armor units, ready for play in BattleTech games up to the year 3136.

Name: Mindburners: Into The Void
Description:
Mindburners: Into the Void is a strategic cyber-occult card drafting and arrangement game for 1-2 players. Loaded up with experimental gear and thrust into the swirling chaos beyond against your will, you must equip and optimize your limited void-tech and outperform your adversary.

In Mindburners: Into the Void, players are disposable test clones owned by Null Corporation, purveyors of the dark waste's finest void-tech. In the company's annual culling rites, a pair of clones are given the opportunity to earn their freedom by testing Null Corporation's most dangerous experimental technology.

Through two alternating rounds of drafting, each player will select their choice of five untested void-tech items, then simultaneously reveal and arrange them in a personal tableau to maximize their score based on position, bonus card scoring abilities, and special triggered abilities.

The player with the most victory points by the end of the scoring phase survives (wins) and is granted their freedom. The other perishes in the cold writhing darkness of the horrific unknown...and is also granted their freedom.

—description from the designer

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Republic vol 1
Description:
Experimental Technical Readout: Republic (Volume 1) samples production and custom machines that have appeared in the BattleTech universe by the early decades of the thirty-second century. Each unit featured in this book incorporates some of the new technologies that debuted in Tactical Operations - now employed by the armed forces of the Republic of the Sphere and its contemporaries.

Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new advanced and experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, and aerospace and battle armor units, ready for play in BattleTech games up to the year 3120.

Name: Invocación Fronteras: Leyendas del Invocador Solitario – El Gólem Demente
Description:
Golems are beings created to fulfill tasks, but the meaning of those tasks depends on the principles of their creator. So if its creator loses its sanity, so will its golem... On your journey through the western wastes you come across one of these creatures guarding a corrupt and obviously dangerous portal. At his feet, his dead master several suns ago. His slave remains obedient fulfilling his insane legacy.

Solitaire mode expansion for InvocaciÃ³n Fronteras.

Includes 2 promo cards:

     Yogzethot (54 - Earth/Fire)
     Incubo (26 - Air): A player discard 1 from their hand, you take 2 from the Portal.



To play in this 1-player mode, you only need a Summon deck and at least one board with which to correctly position the cards of the artificial opponent: the Golem.

The objective of the game is to survive until the end of your 6 summons and get more points than the Golem. If the Golem manages to win 4 matches, the player loses the match and is defeated.

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Most Wanted
Description:
Experimental Tech Readout: Most Wanted samples custom machines that have appeared in the BattleTech universe since the days of the Jihad. Each unit featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere in their war against the Word of Blake, as first described in Tactical Operations--deployed now by some of the Inner Sphere's most dangerous criminals.

Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, and aerospace and battle armor units, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: Alpha Strike – 3039 and 3050 Cards
Description: Alpha Strike 3039 and 3050 Cards includes 108 double-sided cards with all the game stats players need to instantly take to the battlefield. The cards reflect the Units listed in Technical Readout: 3039 and Technical Readout: 3050 and include conventional infantry and Clan Elemental battle armor. Quick-start cards allow you to play Alpha Strike right out of the box. Full-color and laminated for dry-erase use, you just need miniatures and you'll be playing BattleTech like never before!

Name: The Legacy Game
Description:
A mystery box filled with puzzles, evidence, and interviews will be delivered to your door. Each box is a standalone mystery that requires no additional boxes to complete.

Hillview Academy is the most elite private school in Valley Falls.  Six of Hillview’s finest receive a mysterious invitation in their locker to participate in something called The Legacy Game. The game will begin promptly at midnight in the local cemetery at the gravesite of Jefferson F. Pritchard, which the letter describes as one of Valley Falls' most infamous citizens.  The invitation, sent from someone calling themselves The Headmaster, promises a life-changing reward for the winner.  However, no one has ever heard of Jefferson F. Pritchard, and Hillview Academy doesn't have a headmaster.  What is The Legacy Game, who is The Headmaster, and what is so special about a dead man that doesn't show up in any of the Valley Falls history books?  Play The Legacy Game and find out!

Name: BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Ad Hoc Unit Cards
Description: Alpha Strike Ad Hoc Unit Cards includes 90 cards with all the game stats players need to instantly take to the battlefield. Eighty of the cards reflect the Units listed in Alpha Strike, while 10 cards feature notable MechWarrior Units. With these cards, you just need miniatures and you'll be playing BattleTech like never before!

Name: I Cavalieri della Tavola Rotonda
Description:
Fill all the seats on the Round Table. Each turn you can fill one or two (adjacent) seats. The player filling the last seat wins.

The game reimplements Nimclock, a Nim variant.

Published on History Kids, Italian edition, issue #5.

—user summary

Name: Master Minds: A Game of Deduction
Description:
MasterMinds is a GAME OF DEDUCTION where in order to determine who the MasterMind is, what they're like and where they are, you need to make your way around the board and ask the right questions of the other players using your deductive reasoning skills and the process of elimination, trying to be the first to solve the mystery of who and where the MasterMind is and climb their steps to knock on their door.

In a standard game, each player holds three cards, Description, Character and Place. The remaining 3 cards for the round are the MasterMind's cards. With the occasional advantage or disadvantage of Bonuses and Penalties players make their way around the board Asking Questions and Taking Notes using their Solver Pad until they're ready to Climb The Steps to Make Their Guess and find out if they're at the MasterMinds Door!

Is the MasterMind a Lonely Zombie In Your Closet, a Kind Grandma At The Grocery Store, a Frustrated Time Traveler In The Woods???...It could be anyone, anywhere, IT'S TIME TO PLAY AND FIGURE IT OUT!

—description from the publisher

Name: Momentum: A Strategic Dice Game
Description:
You'll need to roll the dice for sets and runs for the chance to move your pawns and go for the win...will you take chances, will you play it safe, do you feel like you can get some momentum and go for that big streak!?!? No score pad, no pencils! Have a strategy, weigh the risks and hope for a little luck!!

Momentum is the STRATEGIC DICE GAME where you choose your roll type, FOCUS (best of three rolls) or MOMENTUM (unlimited amount of single rolls until you can't move) and try to be the first to move your four pawns to the center using SETS and RUNS of the dice to advance your PAWNS. The first with their four in the center wins!

Time to warm up those dice and and see if you can get some MOMENTUM!

—description from the designer

Name: BattleTech: Objectives – The Clans
Description: Objectives: The Clans describes the state of the major factories, training centers, and command centers of the Clans in the wake of the events described in Jihad Hot Spots: Terra. Including detailed stats on every key system, this supplement also includes basic rules to help guide players in developing BattleTech scenarios focused on defending--or attacking--these critical sites.

Name: BattleTech: Objectives – The Periphery
Description: Objectives: Periphery describes the state of the major factories, training centers, and command centers of the Periphery in the wake of the events described in Jihad Hot Spots: Terra. Including detailed stats on every key system, this supplement also includes basic rules to help guide players in developing BattleTech scenarios focused on defending--or attacking--these critical sites.

Name: Micro Game Madness
Description:
A ziplocked compilation of "Eight Classic and Strange Micro Games" (per the cover blurb) from Tri Tac.

—user summary

Name: Ducks in the Pond
Description: A Yatzee-style roll n' write for duck enthusiasts and gamers seeking a fun filler.  Roll a set of dice for six days attempting to collect different classifications of ducks in the Thibodaux, Louisiana reservoir.  Watch out for the weather though which progressively worsens and reduces your dice pool.  Dice may be manipulated in some cases.  Are you a novice, connoisseur, or professional at duck-watching or just there to get an honorable mention?

Name: BattleTech: Objectives – Lyran Alliance
Description: Objectives: Lyran Alliance describes the state of the major factories, training centers, and command centers of House Steiner's Lyran Alliance in the wake of the events described in Jihad Hot Spots: Terra. Including detailed stats on every key system within the realm, this supplement also includes basic rules to help guide players in developing BattleTech scenarios focused on defending--or attacking--these critical sites.

Name: BattleTech: Objectives – Free Worlds League
Description: Objectives: Free Worlds League describes the state of the major factories, training centers, and command centers of House Marik's Free Worlds League in the wake of the events described in Jihad Hot Spots: Terra. Including detailed stats on every key system within the realm, this supplement also includes basic rules to help guide players in developing BattleTech scenarios focused on defending--or attacking--these critical sites.

Name: BattleTech: Objectives – Federated Suns
Description: Objectives: Federated Suns describes the state of the major factories, training centers, and command centers of House Davion's Federated Suns in the wake of the events described in Jihad Hot Spots: Terra. Including detailed stats on every key system within the realm, this supplement also includes basic rules to help guide players in developing BattleTech scenarios focused on defending--or attacking--these critical sites.

Name: BattleTech: Objectives – Draconis Combine
Description: Objectives: Draconis Combine describes the state of the major factories, training centers, and command centers of House Kurita's Draconis Combine in the wake of the events described in Jihad Hot Spots: Terra. Including detailed stats on every key system within the realm, this supplement also includes basic rules to help guide players in developing BattleTech scenarios focused on defending--or attacking--these critical sites.

Name: BattleTech: Objectives – Capellan Confederation
Description: Objectives: Capellan Confederation describes the state of the major factories, training centers, and command centers of House Liao's Capellan Confederation in the wake of the events described in Jihad Hot Spots: Terra. Including detailed stats on every key system within the realm, this supplement also includes basic rules to help guide players in developing BattleTech scenarios focused on defending--or attacking--these critical sites.

Name: Würfelspiel
Description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 75 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The game was published for the 75th anniversary of the Emil Seelig AG, which is symbolized by space 75.

—user summary

Name: District 9: The Boardgame – District Boost Deployable Ally Pack
Description:
10 unique sculpts to aid your hunt.


     Exo Suit 1
     Flying Swine
     Alien Pet
     Gun Tower
     Prawn Thief
     Hidden Bomber
     District Smuggler
     Ride-By-Prawn
     District Witch
     District Acolyte


—description from the publisher

Name: Quatermain
Description:
Hunter. Adventurer. The greatest marksman to ever live. You are Allan Quatermain, searching for wealth deep in colonial era Africa. Grab your gun and wisely choose your allies as you compete in this deck building adventure game. 2-4 players will go on adventures, hunt in the veldt, and trade for new additions to their decks. Try to amass the most wealth, but beware, your allies will determine how many wealth cards you can score at game end.

Each turn consists of four steps:
- Upkeep, if applicable
- Play up to one adventure card
- Go hunting in the veldt
- Make up to one trade for new cards

As you gain new adventure cards, they will open up additional actions, plus you can get upgraded guns to aid in hunting, and allies which remain in play. During Upkeep you select one gun and one ally to journey with you that turn. The game continues until the veldt runs out of animals, at which time whoever can score the most wealth wins.

Name: Squash
Description:
Billed as "fantastic clay combat with creatures you design," Squash is a ziplocked compilation of seven "classic" (per the cover blurb) tabletop-miniatures games from Tri Tac.

—user summary

Name: Broadside Empires of Steel: Three Crowns
Description: Three Crowns introduces two new nations to Broadside: the Kingdom of Italy and the Austro-Hungarian Empire.

Name: Cinematic
Description:
Cinematics is a card game in which players, in the role of director, make various films and participate in international film festivals and win various awards.
Players can use famous superstars to improve the quality of their movies, edit their movies or promote them in various media.

In Cinematic, players must purchase the plan (shot) cards through the special rules of the game to make a movie and then, they must put together genres or matching Kelakets based on the rules, so they can finally create a sequence.
No dice are used in this game and the winner of the game is the one who gets the most points based on the opinions of the jury mentioned in the festival card.
In addition to the main prize of the festival, other players can also win prizes in categories such as “best actor”, “best director”, etc.

Name: Witchfinder General: Days of Revelation
Description:
Witchfinder General: Days of Revelation is set during the period of the 17th Century leading up to the English Civil Wars.

Courageous Witchfinders battle against the many vile abominations that plague a once green and pleasant land.  Clandestine vampire factions, aided by their loyal Guardsmen  of Blind Obedience, secretly strive to gain ultimate power over a deceived nation. Cruel  barguests create fear and mayhem across town and country. Evil witchcraft is rife; vicious werewolves savage the innocent and crazed noctelinger hunt in the shadows.

This exciting wargame rule book contains 108 A4 sized pages of furious wargaming fun. The game is inspired by folklore, myth and the propaganda pamphlets produced by all sides involved in the English Civil Wars. Witchfinder General: Days of Revelation provides background and rules for using: Witchfinders; Angry Villagers; Clubmen; Pikemen; Musketeers; Dragoons; Cavalry; Vampires; Werewolves; Witches; Noctelinger and Barguests.

Designed for use with 28mm scale figures.

—description from the publisher

Name: Knights contest
Description:
Each player receives a knight and a die. The knights are moved towards each other along the tournament path by a dice roll until they meet. Whoever can push the foreign knight back to his starting point with dice rolls wins a tournament point. The first player to achieve an agreed sum of tournament points wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Blast: Klorgon
Description:
Blast: Klorgon is a new faction for the card game Blast that can be swapped for one of the existing factions in the base game to provide greater replayability.

The unique ability of this faction:
"If you play Klorgon with a total value of 15 or more in a trick, you automatically win the trick."

Name: Blast: Jedeye
Description:
Blast: Jedeye is a new faction for the card game Blast that can be swapped for one of the existing factions in the base game to provide greater replayability.

The unique ability of this faction:
"When a Jedeye is used in a winning trick, name a faction and a number. If your opponent has it, they must give it to you."

Name: テキパキもぎもぎ (Quick to Pick)
Description:
In this game, the players are two rival fruit hunters in competition to collect fruits from the forest and make more profits!

Quick to Pick is a set collection game that progresses in real time.
Flip Bush cards and collect fruits!
Place same-pattern or same-shape Fruits on top of each other to form sets.
If 3 monkeys find you, run home and calculate your earnings!
Calculate your earnings according to the Market Price card! Whoever has earned more money wins!

Name: Call to Adventure: The Stormlight Archive – The Thrill Promo Card
Description:
Promotional card included in the The Way of Kings 10th Anniversary Leatherbound Edition Kickstarter campaign.

The Thrill:

You may not gain this trait if you have any Radiants. When you gain this, gain 1 Experience for each Strength Rune or Constitution Rune in your story.

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – 1945
Description:
Experimental Technical Readout: 1945 samples a number of designs that played a key role in the largest, and perhaps most critical conflict in Terra's pre-spaceflight history. Representing the military capabilities of the mid-twentieth century powers, most of the designs featured in this book are obsolete even by the standards of the Age of War, their weapons and armor rendered completely ineffective long before the days of the BattleMech.

But if you're going to insist on using the anyway, statistics are included for 24 iconic vehicles and warplanes of the Second World War, complete with special rules that make them ready for play--either against each other, or against thirty-first century tech in BattleTech games where you need a chuckle.

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Boondocks
Description:
Experimental Technical Readout: Boondocks samples the custom and prototype designs that have begun to turn up on the lesser-known worlds of the BattleTech universe. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere as the war against the Word of Blake continues.

These technologies--first described in Tactical Operations--have yet to achieve widespread production, but each has been prototyped and rushed to the field for their desperate consumers. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, and aerospace units presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Boondoggles
Description:
Experimental Tech Readout: Boondoggles samples some of the most infamous failures in military experiments made by the Inner Sphere and Clan powers throughout history.

Each design featured in this book demonstrates a disastrous (or merely abandoned) combination of prototype technology or engineering employed on BattleMechs, combat vehicles, and aerospace units from the Star League age to the Jihad era. Statistics and (where useful) Record Sheets are included for 14 BattleMechs, vehicles, and aerospace units presented in this book, ready to use (if possible) in advanced BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – The Clans
Description:
Experimental Technical Readout: The Clans samples a number of new designs being produced by the various Clan powers who now call the Inner Sphere home.

Infusing a new wave of advanced Clan technology into the older models at their disposal, most of the designs featured in this book incorporate a mix of modern technologies and design standards the likes of which the Inner Sphere has yet to face in open battle. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, ProtoMechs, vehicles, aerospace fighters, and battle armor are presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – ComStar
Description:
Experimental Technical Readout: ComStar samples the custom and prototype designs that were developed in the testing labs and top-secret proving grounds of ComStar's scattered military. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere as the war against the Word of Blake waged on.

These technologies--first described in Tactical Operations--have only begun to achieve widespread production, but each has been prototyped and rushed to the field for their desperate consumers. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units.

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Corporations
Description:
Experimental Technical Readout: Corporations samples the custom and prototype designs that are still going through their shakedown trials in the corporate research sites throughout the BattleTech universe. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere as the war against the Word of Blake thunders on.

These technologies--first described in Tactical Operations--have yet to face their first actions in real combat, but each has been tailored for an eventual debut on battlefields yet to come. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles and aerospace units presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

Name: Flying Frog DiceFest 2021 Goody Box
Description:
A promotional (plain white) box of goodies made for sale during the virtual DiceFest held in 2021.

For Shadows of Brimstone:

     Grave Robber’s Den / Untouched Wreckage map tile pack
         2 Map cards (Mine and Blasted Wastes, P-914 and P-916)
         2 Encounter cards (Corpse Cart and Fresh Salvage, P-915 and P-917)
         1 double-sided map tile (Grave Robber’s Den / Untouched Wreckage)
         1 double-sided double map tile connector‡ (Mine / Blasted Wastes); 2 squares deep
         1 double-sided single map tile connector† (Mine / Blasted Wastes); 1 square deep
         2 double-sided single map tile connectors† (Forbidden Fortress / Forest of the Dead and Forbidden Fortress / Belly of the Beast); 1 square deep
    
     Master Samurai Dice Fest 2021 Miniature
     Rusty Shovel promo card P-497
     Masterclass Revolver promo card P-338
     Keg of Dynamite promo card P-329
     Infinite Darkness promo card P-339


 
For A Touch of Evil: Dark Gothic:`

     Duel of Honor promo card P-052
     Horse Chase promo card P-051


 
† These are essentially 1.25 inch "corridors"
‡ This is essentially a 2.5 inch "corridor"

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Davion
Description:
Experimental Technical Readout: Davion samples the custom and prototype designs that have begun to turn up in testing labs and top-secret proving grounds of the Federated Suns. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere as the war against the Word of Blake continues.

These technologies--first described in Tactical Operations--have yet to achieve widespread production, but each has been prototyped and rushed to the field for their desperate consumers. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units, and battle armor designs presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

Name: Dungeon Ball Legend
Description:
Take your team to the championship and become the best quarterback in the league along the way. This solitaire game is a mashup of the Dungeon Ball theme and the Hunted system.

Dungeon Ball Legend can be played in two modes: Exhibition (one game) or Season (six games). In each game, you’ll attempt to guide your team to victory by scoring more points than your opponent, and you’ll try to rack up as many highlights as possible to gain votes in the race to win the Hegzug Trophy (it’s kind of like the Heisman…).

—description from the publisher

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Gladiators
Description:
Experimental Tech Readout: Gladiators samples the custom designs that have appeared in the arenas of the BattleTech universe during the Jihad. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere as the war against the Word of Blake continues.

These technologies--first described in Tactical Operations--now face their live-fire trials in the arenas of the various Game Worlds. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, and battle armor units, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Gunslingers
Description:
Experimental Tech Readout: Gunslingers samples some of the advanced technological experiments developed during the peak years of the Star League era.

Each design featured in this book demonstrates the use of cutting edge Star League equipment on the BattleMechs, combat vehicles, and aerospace craft of the day. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 BattleMechs, vehicles, and aerospace units presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Kurita
Description:
Experimental Technical Readout: Kurita samples the custom and prototype designs that have begun to turn up in testing labs and top-secret proving grounds of the Draconis Combine. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere as the war against the Word of Blake continues.

These technologies--first described in Tactical Operations--have yet to achieve widespread production, but each has been prototyped and rushed to the field for their desperate consumers. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units, and battle armor designs presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

Name: Salt Mystic
Description:
Salt Mystic is a science fiction-themed tabletop game based on terrain and trading cards, where the placement and orientation of the cards drive gameplay. Cards represent fleshed-out characters or the vehicles or vehicle upgrades they use, or major story elements that can be played to shift the game's dynamics. It feels like playing a streamlined Warhammer 40k with Magic: The Gathering cards.

1 - 2 players, ages 12 and up, games lasting 30 mins to 1 hr.

Played on a tabletop with cards, six-sided dice, a ruler, and elements representing terrain. Everything required to get started is available in the Sourcebook And Core Rules.

The narrative background of the game and its associated and ongoing book series is based on classics like Dune, Star Wars, Firefly, and Isaac Asimov's Foundation series:

"Two thousand years ago, the Salt Mystic declared her vision of the forces of history, and how to harness them to shape human events. Naraia was the name they gave to the sprawling republic that arose from her teachings, encompassing countless cities on land, floating on the seas and tethered to the seafloor, and tucked into pockets of artificial space called oriels.

All of that shattered a generation ago in a terrifying and almost supernatural conflict called 'The War Of The Rupture'. Now, roving bands of Naraia's remnant fleets and soldiers and its marvelous machines scatter like maple seeds for anyone with a vision to seize them. And abandoned oriels lie in wait for brave explorers with the heart to enter inside."

—description from the publisher

Name: Carolus Variant Chess
Description: Classical chess has its deserved place as the Western reference of abstract strategic games, this game was conceived as one of the various variants and derivatives of "Chaturanga" (game of Indian origin), under that line this proposal derives from classic chess modifying and contributing in mechanics and themes with the intention of providing a fun, modern, accessible, dynamic and deep game alternative.

Name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: German – Panther
Description:
The Panther is a powerhouse in every sense of the word with great mobility and firepower allowing you to really run the tank hard on the battlefield. All of this does come at a slight cost however – Weak Flank means that it is susceptible to shots coming in from the side and rear which means you may want to buff it’s initiative stat. Enhanced Suspension is a cheap way to gain a additional point in the movement phase, whilst driver Phil Stulpnagel can improve it even more and adding the sort-after Smooth Ride ability.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: World of Tanks Miniatures Game (Wargaming.net / GF9)
